title: Las Vegas Sands Shares Climb 5% as Stock Heads to S&P 500
text:
By Stephen Nakrosis

Shares of Las Vegas Sands Corp. (LVS) are trading higher in after-hours action Thursday, following news the company will be replacing Nektar Therapeutics (NKTR) in the S&P 500.

At 5:33 p.m. ET, Las Vegas Sands shares had gained 5.05% to trade at $58.70 per share. After-hours volume topped 82,000 shares. The company's shares ended the day's regular trading session with a 2.1% loss, to close at $55.88.

The gambling and hospitality company is up over 7% year to date.

Shares of Nektar, which is moving to the S&P 400, are 1.94% higher in after-hours trading, to $17.90.

--Write to Stephen Nakrosis at stephen.nakrosis@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

September 26, 2019 17:54 ET (21:54 GMT)
